ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Model_parameter may be a or a , or additionally may be an , a , a , or a . A Model_parameter is a formally declared variable of the provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment. The unit_of_measure for the Model_parameter shall be consistent with the unit_of_measure for the values assigned to the parameter, either as defaults or through explicit assignment. The default values are explicitly intended to be overridden by explicit assignment, when that explicit assignment references a Model_parameter.
In Spice, temperature is a Model_parameter that may be set at the execution time.

the default_value specifies the for the Model_parameter. The default_value specifies either a or a for the parameter. The default_value need not be specified for a particular Model_parameter. When a collection of data types needs to be defined, so that an instance of the collection may be referenced, the Coordinated_characteristic is used. The specifies the reference_document to define the semantics of the collection.

the valid_range specifies the of the Model_parameter. The valid_range need not be specified for a particular Model_parameter. There shall be one or more Coordinated_characteristic for a Model_parameter. The valid_ranges need not be contiguous.

the reference_document specifies either an or an identifier for the standard document that contains the reference for the Model_parameter. The reference_document shall define the mapping between the parameter_type string values and the semantics to be applied by a simulator, except for the case of physical_property_type which is predefined in this part of ISO 10303.

the unit_of_measure specifies the string used as the descriptive label for the unit of measure associated with the Model_parameter. The unit_of_measure need not be specified for a particular Model_parameter. The representation of units described in ISO 10303-41 shall be used.

A Parameter_assignment is the association of either a or with a , used to provide actual values for characteristics declared formally by the the . The values assigned by the Parameter_assignment shall override any default values specified by the referenced by the assigned_parameter attribute. The Parameter_assignment declares to the receiving system that the types that are associated are compatible. It is the responsibility of the sending system to ensure this is the case. Type compatibility is in the end a matter of resolving data dictionaries. This standard provides facilities for ensuring a common data dictionary is available for base types such as length, frequency.
Due to possibilities of disparate source systems, it is not practical to forbid a Characteristic from being typed. The same Characteristic might be a physical_device_characteristic for a Physical_unit and a parameter_value for a Parameter_assignment in order to ensure accuracy.

A Parameter_assignment_override is the association between a and another which replaces or overrides the first . Parameter_assignment_override is used when an is referenced but some of the Parameter_assignments need to be replaced.
the overriding_parameter_assignment specifies the role of the for the Parameter_assignment_override.

the overridden_parameter_assignment specifies the role of the for the Parameter_assignment_override. The model_parameter_assignment binds instance data to data slots in the .
For each parameter declared in a model definition, an actual value must be assigned when that model is referenced, unless there is a default assignment included in the source code for the model.

A Category_model_parameter is a type of . A Category_model_parameter is a formally declared variable of the provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment. The primary use for a Category_model_parameter is for creation and sharing of catalog data element definitions.

A Schema_based_model_parameter is a type of . A Schema_based_model_parameter is a reference to an attribute and entity in a formal model for the purposes of later extracting data from a model instance or populating data in a model instance. The schema identifier uses application of the ASN 1 notation standardized in part 1 of this standard.
In rule definition, it is often necessary to reference entity data types or their attributes as a parameter.

the schema_identifier specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the schema for the Schema_based_model_parameter.
The identifier for the AIM schema from ISO 10303-210:2001 is "{ 1 0 10303 210 1 1 1 }".
the attribute_name specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the attribute name for the Schema_based_model_parameter.
the entity_name specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the entity name for the Schema_based_model_parameter.
